snippet: There is still no nationwide settlement over practices at mortgage servicing companies. But a couple of state attorneys general have been taking matters into their own hands.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column praises attorneys general Martha Coakley of Massachusetts and Catherine Cortez Masto of Nevada for filing suits against big banks to hold them accountable for their role in the mortgage foreclosure scandal despite lack of nationwide settlement over practices at mortgage servicing companies.
lead_paragraph: There is still no nationwide settlement over practices at mortgage servicing companies. But a couple of state attorneys general have been taking matters into their own hands.

headline.seo: Mortgage Servicing Horror Stories - Fair Game
headline.main: From East and West, Foreclosure Horror Stories
headline.print_headline: From East And West, Foreclosure Horror Stories
